Concepts.definition: Of, or related to, the abdomen.

A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.
A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ReferenceDocuments.name: 3-D medical imaging of the ab
ReferenceDocuments.description: 3-D medical imaging of the abdominal region to determine anatomic features and correlates of digestive diseases and cancers.
